pr_title: Improve implementation of DistributedCp and other distributed jobs

timeline.message: Make sure directories are created properly
handle folder overwrite better. Delete DistributedMv
Remove some tests and fix non-folder cp behavior
Add DistributedMv and make implementation into Cp + Delete

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a CLI option for the user to be able to change this setting?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: This number is large enough and it hasn't actually mattered in distributedLoad case.
replies.author: bradyoo

timeline.bodyText: Do we need these variables anymore if this class extends AbstractDistributedJobCommand?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText:
If this can throw an exception, should we try to catch it, to let the user know that the copy phase did not complete, so it might be in an inconsistent state?
If it is in an inconsistent state, what happens if we run distributedMv again?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: distributedMv fails because overwrite is broken. But at the very least, you can delete the destination directory and then rerun distributedMv
replies.author: bradyoo

replies.bodyText: Ok, but when the cp part fails, the user won't know what to do right? Should we catch this error, print out some instructions on what to do, and then re-throw the error, so we can show that they will have to delete the destination dir, and then rerun mv?
replies.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Is it intentional that this while loop is very tight? Can we add a sleep in here to avoid too much unnecessary cpu?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Did we always print out every file? This could be a huge output, if we are copying a large tree?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: We didn't but we did for distributedLoad and that has been popular so choosing that instead.
replies.author: bradyoo

timeline.bodyText:
This is not threadsafe so we should add synchronized for this method.
Also, maybe rename to waitForCompleteJob?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: This is a command. There is nothing threadsafe about anything in any of these series of classes.
replies.author: bradyoo

timeline.bodyText: createFolders does a listing, and copy also does a listing. Can we avoid doing a double recursive listing of the source?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText:
I would prefer not because:

copy is expensive anyways so listStatus is a small cost here.
More intuitive log messages.
replies.author: bradyoo

replies.bodyText:
Could you explain why it is more intuitive with 2 listings, and why 1 listing cannot have good messages?
One concern is that if a listing is a large tree, it would have to lock that large tree twice. Ideally, we would only have to lock that subtree once.
replies.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Can we just use the abstract class DEFAULT_ACTIVE_JOBS, instead of defining it again here?
timeline.author: gpang

timeline.bodyText: Is there a specific reason we need to loop so quickly? For example, if we loop every second, does that slow anything down unnecessarily?
timeline.author: gpang

replies.bodyText: Second will be quite detrimental to the performance of this when copying lots of small files that were initially held back by a backlog of other jobs.
replies.author: bradyoo
